title: Trump pleads not guilty at federal arraignment in Florida
description: Former US president makes first court appearance as he faces federal charges of mishandling classified government files.

title: NATO chief offers Vilnius summit preview at White House
description: Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg vowed to 'sustain and step up' support for Ukraine as it faces Russian invasion.

title: US grain merchants Bunge, Viterra to merge to create giant
description: The deal, unprecedented in size in the sector, will make a trading giant and is likely to reduce competition.

title: Acclaimed US novelist Cormac McCarthy dies at 89
description: Known for his dark tales of Americana, including No Country for Old Men, McCarthy was an icon in modern US literature.

title: White House to review ruling that press secretary broke Hatch Act
description: A ruling by a government agency said Karine Jean-Pierre violated a law limiting political activity by federal employees.

title: UN food agency says will slash Syria aid by about half
description: World Food Programme funding crisis means aid will be cut to 2.5 million of 5.5 million people reliant on agency.

title: Are migrants the political pawns in EU’s aid offer to Tunisia?
description: The EU's offer of 1 billion euros to Tunisia has been criticised by rights groups, saying it compromises refugee rights.

title: Ukraine’s losses ‘catastrophic’, no need for martial law: Putin
description: Russian leader says no need for new round of mobilisation for now, claims Ukraine has suffered 'catastrophic' losses.

title: US lawmaker group wants S Africa punished over Russia ties
description: US lawmakers urge Biden to move a US-Africa trade summit over 'deepening military relationship' with Russia.

title: Migrant death toll nearly 3,800 for Middle East, North Africa: UN
description: International Organization for Migration recorded 3,789 deaths in 2022, an 11 percent jump from the previous year.

title: Sprinter Tori Bowie died from childbirth complications: Autopsy
description: Olympic medallist and former 100-metre world champion showed signs of undergoing labour when discovered dead on May 2.

title: Israeli army kills Palestinian in occupied West Bank raid
description: At least eight other Palestinians wounded by Israeli forces during raid on Balata refugee camp in Nablus.

title: ‘If we came second, we got nothing’: Berlusconi’s football legacy
description: The ex-Italian PM, who has died aged 86, revolutionised AC Milan's fortunes and leveraged that success into politics.

title: US consumer prices rise moderately; underlying inflation strong
description: The latest data indicates the US Federal Reserve could continue with its interest rate hikes later in the summer.

title: Former Twitter CEO talks Musk takeover, censorship and AI threat
description: Jack Dorsey discusses Elon Musk, Twitter controversies, government censorship, and the future of AI.

title: Trump’s arraignment: The scene outside the Miami courthouse
description: A pig's head on a spike, Uncle Sam on a hoverboard and a frenzy of journalists all waiting for the former president.

title: Thousands displaced as Mayon volcano in Philippines spews lava
description: Lava seen flowing slowly from the mouth of the 2,462-metre (8,077-foot) volcano in Albay province.

title: Three Tunisian opposition leaders on hunger strike in prison
description: Ennahdha party leaders stop eating to protest against their imprisonment on terrorism, money-laundering charges.

title: Belarus will not hesitate to use nukes if aggressed: Lukashenko
description: Minsk is set to host Russian tactical nuclear weapons in several days, says the Belarusian leader.

title: Who is Folashodun Shonubi, Nigeria’s new central bank chief?
description: The appointment of the acting governor comes after the suspension and arrest of his powerful predecessor at the weekend.

title: Why Shin Bet may be used to police Palestinian areas in Israel
description: PM Netanyahu is strongly considering deploying the internal security service to police Palestinian citizens of Israel.

title: Why Muslims are fleeing a small town in India’s Uttarakhand state
description: Nearly a dozen families are forced to leave Purola after far-right Hindu groups threaten Muslims' homes and businesses.

title: From poacher to protector: A turtle guard in Ivory Coast
description: A poacher-turned-protector painstakingly works to conserve threatened sea turtles in Ivory Coast.

title: AI must not become a driver of human rights abuses
description: It is the responsibility of AI companies to ensure their products do not facilitate violations of human rights.

title: Eritrea rejoins East Africa bloc after exit 16 years ago
description: Eritrea quit the body in 2007 in protest of its neighbour Ethiopia deploying troops to Somalia to fight al-Shabab.

title: Main hearings open into UK’s handling of COVID-19 pandemic
description: The first evidence is due to be heard in the inquiry since it was formally launched in June 2022.

title: As a woman is jailed, UK urged to reform ‘outdated’ abortion laws
description: Public anger rises after a judge decided to prosecute a woman who secured pills for a late-term abortion.

title: Ukraine’s counteroffensive begins: What do we know so far?
description: Al Jazeera's Defence Editor Alex Gatopoulos explains the dynamics of a new phase in the 16-month war.

title: Ethnic violence in Sudan raises genocide alarm as war rages on
description: Activists and observers have warned that unchecked violence could prove worse than Darfur's previous cycle of killings.

title: How do the Sierra Leonean elections work? A simple guide
description: Sierra Leone elects a new president and government this June. Here’s what you need to know about the election.

title: Nigeria: Boat capsizes in river Niger, 100 feared dead
description: The incident happened on the river Niger in central Nigeria early on Monday.

title: Cyclone Biparjoy to hit India, Pakistan: What we know so far
description: The two nations brace as the year's first powerful cyclone approaches their western and southern coasts respectively.

title: Djokovic raises bar to 23 slams: Is he the greatest of all time?
description: Whether the Serbian's French Open win makes him the GOAT of men's tennis depends on who you ask and the metrics you use.

title: Denver Nuggets take home first NBA title with win over Miami Heat
description: Serbian Nikola Jokic smashes a 56-year-old playoff record with 10 triple-doubles and scored 28 points with 16 rebounds.

title: At least nine people injured in Denver shooting
description: Police say three of those injured are in critical condition and a suspect was shot and is in custody.

title: UN chief Guterres backs proposal to form watchdog to monitor AI
description: Secretary-general says the risks posed by artificial intelligence threatens democracy and human rights.

title: Trump’s arraignment: What to expect at court appearance in Miami?
description: Former US President Donald Trump is set to appear in court in Miami at 3pm (19:00 GMT) to face 37 felony counts.

title: Fate of jailed fighters still unknown months after Ethiopia truce
description: The whereabouts of hundreds of fighters on both sides of the Ethiopian war are still not known, despite truce.

title: Three people found dead in Nottingham: UK police
description: At least three people have been found dead in Nottingham, police say, after declaring a serious incident.

title: How common is albinism and what gene causes it?
description: Albinism Awareness Day aims to promote understanding of albinism and combat discrimination against people with albinism.

title: Read the full text of the Donald Trump indictment
description: On Tuesday, Trump is set to appear in federal court in Florida, days after being indicted on 37 charges.

title: US says 22 soldiers injured in Syria helicopter accident
description: Enemy fire not reported at time of US helicopter 'mishap' in northeast Syria where hundreds of US soldiers are based.

title: Rights groups to screen BBC film on Modi before White House visit
description: Human Rights Watch and Amnesty International schedule a private screening, two days ahead of Indian PM's state visit.

title: How are US sanctions affecting life in Venezuela?
description: Proponents say economic penalties are an effective foreign policy tool, but critics say they are collective punishment.

title: India threatened to shut down Twitter, founder says
description: Jack Dorsey says India threatened company with shutdown and raids on employees if critical posts were not taken down.

title: Police say driver going too fast in fatal Australia bus crash
description: The driver could face years in prison if found guilty after 10 people were killed when the bus came off the road.

title: Rescued Colombia children recovering, relatives in custody tussle
description: The Colombian Family Welfare Institute says the four children are 'in high spirits' as relatives claim custody.

title: Twitter CEO pledges ‘world’s most accurate real-time information’
description: Linda Yaccarino lays out her vision for 'Twitter 2.0' a week after taking the helm of the troubled Musk-owned platform.

title: Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas arrives in Beijing
description: Four-day state visit comes amid hopes China can help facilitate Israeli-Palestinian peace talks.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 475
description: As the war enters it 475th day, these are the main developments.

title: NATO’s largest air force drill prepares for ‘crisis situation’
description: Some 250 aircraft from 25 NATO and partner countries with 10,000 military personnel participating in 'Air Defender 23'.

title: ‘Massive’ Russian missile attack on Ukraine’s Kryvyi Rih city
description: At least three people killed and 25 wounded in Russian missile attack on Kryvyi Rih city in central Ukraine.

title: New Zealand’s RNZ apologises for ‘pro-Kremlin garbage’ on Ukraine
description: Public broadcaster undertaking an audit after stories on Ukraine published on its website found to have been edited.

title: Kylian Mbappe informs PSG he will not extend contract: Media
description: Reports suggested that Paris Saint-Germain were hopeful Mbappe would trigger a contract extension.

title: China spinning a ‘web’ of influence campaigns to win over Taiwan
description: Away from the headline grabbing military threats, Beijing's propaganda department is working to woo hearts and minds.

title: Top Mexican officials resign in preparation for presidential runs
description: Mayor Claudia Sheinbaum and Foreign Relations Secretary Marcelo Ebrard will compete to be the MORENA party nominee.
